definition: a turn for the better/to pick up/to improve

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: He's getting along hand over hand; he'll soon be convalescent.
sentences.chinese: 他的情况逐步有了起色，不久就会康复的。

sentences.english: Home Wang is sunken not improvement, the problem is on a poor word.
sentences.chinese: 王家凹不起色，问题就在一个穷字上。

sentences.english: On some estimates, even online advertising could pick up by the end of the year.［419 words］
sentences.chinese: 根据一些预测，网络广告到年底也会有起色。

sentences.english: I cannot see any improvement in your writing.
sentences.chinese: 看不出你的写作有什么起色。

sentences.english: His early years at the bar were very lean.
sentences.chinese: 他早年在律师界的工作毫无起色。

sentences.english: He has made progress in every aspect.
Debt soared but the country did not recover for a decade.
sentences.chinese: 结果负债率飚升，而十年下来，日本经济却毫无起色。

sentences.english: We will help Iraq train its security forces and develop its economy.
sentences.chinese: 我们将援救伊拉克教练安全盘队和起色经济。

sentences.english: 'The market will remain at a weak level for the next year or two, ' Mr. Watanabe said.
sentences.chinese: 渡边捷昭表示，日本市场在今后一两年仍难有起色。

sentences.english: The firm will go under unless business improves.
sentences.chinese: 生意若无起色，公司非垮不可。

sentences.english: I haven't seen any improvement at all over the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 这几年来我丝毫没看到一点转好的起色。

sentences.english: There followed something of a fallow period professionally, until a job came up in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 接着在事业上无甚起色，直到夏季有了一份工作。

sentences.english: These big emperor appreciated the Han economy made lackluster.
sentences.chinese: 桑弘羊大得武帝赏识，汉朝经济立见起色。

sentences.english: 'The market will remain at a weak level for the next year or two,' Mr. Watanabe said.
sentences.chinese: 渡边捷昭表示，日本市场在今后一两年仍难有起色。

sentences.english: Thanks to acupuncture therapy the patient is getting along very well.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏用了针刺疗法，病人大有起色。

sentences.english: To date, very little mining of Russian Alexandrite is taking place.
sentences.chinese: 至今人们在亚历山大石的开采上几乎毫无起色。

definition: to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
change of appearance/to revise one's point of view
(of the weather) to warm up again
to make a contribution/to establish/to found/contribution
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
